intro: Eriogonum lemmonii, commonly known as Lemmon's buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It has hairy stems and leaves that are often covered in fine, soft pubescence. Eriogonum lemmonii is adapted to withstand drought and is an important plant in its native ecosystems.
